title: 1995–96 Courage League National Division Two
text:
The 1995–96 Courage League National Division Two was the ninth full season of <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> within the second tier of the English league system, currently known as the <a href="RFU%20Championship">RFU Championship</a>. Joining the seven teams who participated in 1994–95 were Northampton relegated from Courage League Division One, and Bedford Blues and Blackheath who were both promoted from the third tier.
<a href="Northampton%20Saints">Northampton</a>, the champions, were promoted to the <a href="English%20Premiership%20%28rugby%20union%29">Courage League National Division One</a> for season <a href="1996%E2%80%9397%20English%20Premiership%20%28rugby%20union%29">1996–97</a> along with <a href="London%20Irish">London Irish</a> who were the runners–up. It was the second time Northampton had won the Division Two title and it was also the second time a team had won all of their matches in a season. <a href="Bedford%20Blues">Bedford Blues</a> finished last but were not relegated to <a href="National%20League%201">Courage League National Division Three</a> due to the expansion of Division Two in 1996–97 to twelve teams.
Sponsorship.
National Division Two is part of the Courage Clubs Championship and is sponsored by <a href="Courage%20Brewery">Courage Brewery</a>
